input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies the full e-mail address to which the report should be sent.

Specifies the number of past hours for which to show activity in the report. This parameter must be an integer between 1 and 24. If you do not specify this parameter, all past information is included.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:param name="hours">${hours}</xsl:param> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh ras diagnostics show configuration type=email destination=${destination}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${hours}')!=0 "> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="$hours > 0 and $hours < 25"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> hours=${hours}</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> hours=24</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> verbose=enabled</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Creates a Remote Access Diagnostic Report that includes only diagnostics results for Installed Devices, Process Information, Command-Line Utilities, and Phone Book Files and delivers the report to a location you specify.
